title: Pull Off These Spring Beauty Trends with Latina-Owned Brands
description: With spring on the horizon, we’re ready to retire our cool, winter looks for makeup that feels as bright and daring as the warmer season. The 2025 beauty trends are all about creating your own rules and finding your own balance, from wearing a metallic eye, a light shimmery blush, or cherry lips. Whether you’re embracing soft pastels for a feminine spring or prefer to stand out with bold retro hues, Latina-owned cosmetic brands have the nail polishes, lipsticks, blushes, foundations, and eyeshadows to help you complete your springtime looks.All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.Coquette Nails No aesthetic embodies springtime charm quite like coquette, and Lights Lacquer’s Coquette Collection comes with everything you need to pull off soft and sweet nail looks. From shimmery pastel pink, green, lavender, and white nail polishes to adorable nail tattoos of vintage-inspired bunnies, lambs, and kitties, this set is for those embracing their soft girl era this season.Lights Lacquer Coquette Nail Collection by Lights Lacquer, $, available at Lights LacquerCherry Girl LipsCherry girls are thriving this season. Following the deep red nail trend of the winter, you'll find more folks bringing these shades to their cheeks and lips. Bésame Cosmetics brings this classic warm hue to the present with its Blood Red Lipstick, a tribute to the rebellious courage and strength of the suffragettes.Bésame Cosmetics Besame Cosmetics Blood Red Lipstick, $, available at Bésame CosmeticsShimmer, EverywhereY2K beauty looks are still here, and so is all the shimmer of the early 2000s. From your eyes to your cheeks and to your lips, Alamar Cosmetics' Viva Las Cheekas is the perfect sparkly makeup set with creams, powder blushes, and glitter transformers to keep your whole face glistening. Even more, the brand formulated three sets for various skin tones.Alamar Cosmetics Alamar Cosmetics' Viva Las Cheekas, $, available at Alamar CosmeticsSatin SkinSatin skin is the latest no-makeup makeup trend. It's all about dewy, medium coverage so your skin can look like, well, skin. Ere Perez's Oat Milk foundation is a lightweight, non-greasy buildable foundation that's hydrating, creamy, and breathable. Ere Perez Ere Perez's Oat Milk Foundation, $, available at Ere PerezFlush BlushTo complete the natural skin look, there’s of course the flush blush, creamy pink and purple blushes to make your cheeks appear naturally scarlet. Rare Beauty's Soft Pinch Liquid Blush is a weightless, long-lasting, buildable blush that comes in various shades with dewy and matte finishes to help you achieve the flushed look you desire.Rare Beauty Rare Beauty's Soft Pinch Liquid Blush, $, available at Rare BeautyMetallic EyesNostalgia isn’t just about Y2K and ‘90s trends. The 1980s are also back, with more people opting for a bolder, metallic shadow this spring. Pull off this daring eye look with Melt Cosmetics' Clockwork Purple Metaleyez, a duo chrome eyeshadow gel that blends magenta violet with olive gold.Melt Cosmetics Melt Cosmetics' Clockwork Purple Metaleyez, $, available at Melt CosmeticsColor Block EyelinerAnother way to achieve retro eyes: painting bold hues over your eyelids for an unexpected shock of color. Araceli Beauty's Ojos Perfectos Gel Pencil Eyeliner Set is the perfect pack to achieve this look with a mix of shimmery bright and warm shades.Araceli Beauty Araceli Beauty's Gel Pencil Eyeliner Set, $, available at Araceli BeautyNatural BrowsEyebrow shapes vary greatly, so "natural brows" will mean something different for everyone. Whether your brows are fluffy and full, micro-sculpted, or feathered, Vive Cosmetics’ brow pencil bundle includes long-wearing dual-ended retractable brow pencils in two natural matte shades to help you elevate your natural brows.Vive Cosmetics Vive Cosmetics' Brow Pencil Bundle, $, available at Vive CosmeticsLike what you see? How about some more R29 goodness, right here?
author: Raquel Reichard

html:
Photo: Courtesy of Alamar Cosmetics.

With spring on the horizon, we’re ready to retire our cool, winter looks for makeup that feels as bright and daring as the warmer season. The 2025 beauty trends are all about creating your own rules and finding your own balance, from wearing a metallic eye, a light shimmery blush, or cherry lips. 

Whether you’re embracing soft pastels for a feminine spring or prefer to stand out with bold retro hues, Latina-owned cosmetic brands have the nail polishes, lipsticks, blushes, foundations, and eyeshadows to help you complete your springtime looks.

All linked products are independently selected by our editors. If you purchase any of these products, we may earn a commission.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

1 of 8

Coquette Nails 
No aesthetic embodies springtime charm quite like coquette, and Lights Lacquer’s Coquette Collection comes with everything you need to pull off soft and sweet nail looks. From shimmery pastel pink, green, lavender, and white nail polishes to adorable nail tattoos of vintage-inspired bunnies, lambs, and kitties, this set is for those embracing their soft girl era this season.

2 of 8

Cherry Girl Lips
Cherry girls are thriving this season. Following the deep red nail trend of the winter, you'll find more folks bringing these shades to their cheeks and lips. Bésame Cosmetics brings this classic warm hue to the present with its Blood Red Lipstick, a tribute to the rebellious courage and strength of the suffragettes.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

3 of 8

Shimmer, Everywhere
Y2K beauty looks are still here, and so is all the shimmer of the early 2000s. From your eyes to your cheeks and to your lips, Alamar Cosmetics' Viva Las Cheekas is the perfect sparkly makeup set with creams, powder blushes, and glitter transformers to keep your whole face glistening. Even more, the brand formulated three sets for various skin tones.

4 of 8

Satin Skin
Satin skin is the latest no-makeup makeup trend. It's all about dewy, medium coverage so your skin can look like, well, skin. Ere Perez's Oat Milk foundation is a lightweight, non-greasy buildable foundation that's hydrating, creamy, and breathable.

5 of 8

Flush Blush
To complete the natural skin look, there’s of course the flush blush, creamy pink and purple blushes to make your cheeks appear naturally scarlet. Rare Beauty's Soft Pinch Liquid Blush is a weightless, long-lasting, buildable blush that comes in various shades with dewy and matte finishes to help you achieve the flushed look you desire.

6 of 8

Metallic Eyes
Nostalgia isn’t just about Y2K and ‘90s trends. The 1980s are also back, with more people opting for a bolder, metallic shadow this spring. Pull off this daring eye look with Melt Cosmetics' Clockwork Purple Metaleyez, a duo chrome eyeshadow gel that blends magenta violet with olive gold.

8 of 8

Natural Brows
Eyebrow shapes vary greatly, so "natural brows" will mean something different for everyone. Whether your brows are fluffy and full, micro-sculpted, or feathered, Vive Cosmetics’ brow pencil bundle includes long-wearing dual-ended retractable brow pencils in two natural matte shades to help you elevate your natural brows.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT
